Detailed Description

Message queue.

Message queue is used for communication of separate threads by means of sending messages to each other. Thus, when one thread sends a message to another one, it asks that another thread to execute some code portion - handler code of the message. Each Thread object already contains its own queue object (Thread::queue), but one is free to create his/her own Queue objects when they are needed. NOTE: Queue implements Waitable interface which means that it can be used in conjunction with ting::WaitSet API. But, note, that the implementation of the Waitable is that it shall only be used to wait for READ. If you are trying to wait for WRITE the behavior will be undefined.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ting::Queue::Queue (  )  [inline]

Constructor, creates empty message queue.

ting::Queue::~Queue (  )  [inline]

Destructor.

When called, it also destroys all messages on the queue.

Member Function Documentation

Ptr<Message> ting::Queue::GetMsg (  )  [inline]

Get message from queue, blocks if no messages queued.

This method gets a message from message queue. If there are no messages on the queue it will wait until any message is posted to the queue. Note, that this method, due to its implementation, is not intended to be called from multiple threads simultaneously (unlike Queue::PeekMsg()). If it is called from multiple threads the behavior will be undefined. It is also forbidden to call GetMsg() from one thread and PeekMsg() from another thread on the same Queue instance, because it will also lead to undefined behavior.

Returns:
auto-pointer to Message instance.
Ptr<Message> ting::Queue::PeekMsg (  )  [inline]

Get message from queue, does not block if no messages queued.

This method gets a message from message queue. If there are no messages on the queue it will return invalid auto pointer.

Returns:
auto-pointer to Message instance.
invalid auto-pointer if there are no messares in the queue.
